title: How To Get Your Kids To Eat More Vegetables
summary: You don’t have to give up on veggies completely if your child doesn't like them. Some veggies are just easier for kids to accept than others. You can't expect your child to go from eating nothing but pizza to eating a salad with croutons every night. It’s important to start with baby steps and work your way up. Hiding vegetables in other foods is a great way to get your kids to eat more vegetables in their diet. Don't forget dessert. Dark chocolate has lots of antioxidants and will help boost your child's immune system.

content.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("h2",null,"Find The Right Veggies"),mdx("p",null,`When you\u2019re trying to get your kids to eat more vegetables, you might feel like you\u2019ve got two options \u2013 either they eat nothing at all or they eat everything in the produce section.
You don\u2019t have to give up on veggies completely if your child doesn\u2019t like them \u2013 but you shouldn\u2019t push it either.`),mdx("p",null,"Some veggies are just easier for kids to accept than others. Even though all veggies are nutritious, some are more nutritious than others."),mdx("p",null,"Broccoli and cauliflower are good examples of this. They\u2019re both healthy \u2013 but broccoli is even better for you."),mdx("p",null,"But broccoli is also a bit of a pain to eat for a small child. It\u2019s not easy to chew, and it\u2019s even harder to swallow. Cauliflower, on the other hand, is much easier to eat. It\u2019s softer and has a much milder flavour."),mdx("h2",null,"Start With Baby Steps"),mdx("p",null,"You can\u2019t expect your child to go from eating nothing but pizza to eating a salad with croutons every night. You\u2019ll just end up frustrated and they\u2019ll end up hungry."),mdx("p",null,"It\u2019s important to start with baby steps and work your way up. You might want to start with smoothies or fruit snacks that combine some veggies with some fruit. That way, the kids get a bit of everything they need in one go."),mdx("p",null,"You can also try hiding vegetables in other foods. It might sound sneaky, but it\u2019s a great way to get your kids to start including more vegetables in their diet."),mdx("p",null,"If you have them on your side, you\u2019ll have made a great start to getting them eating better. Once they\u2019ve got used to eating veggies, they\u2019ll be able to start weeding out the ones they don\u2019t like. At that point, you can encourage them to try new things."),mdx("h2",null,"Sneak It In"),mdx("p",null,`As we\u2019ve said, you shouldn\u2019t try to sneak all the veggies into everything, but it can be a good way to start.
While you can\u2019t just put broccoli in everything, you can add spices and herbs which have a similar effect.`),mdx("p",null,"Cinnamon, for example, is great for regulating blood sugar levels. It\u2019s also a fantastic antioxidant. If you add cinnamon to your kid\u2019s food, they won\u2019t even know that they\u2019re eating something good for them."),mdx("p",null,"If you want to add a vegetable to something and make it barely noticeable, try adding spinach or avocado. They\u2019re both very mild and will barely change the flavour of the food you\u2019re adding them to."),mdx("h2",null,"Don't Forget Dessert"),mdx("p",null,`If your kid doesn\u2019t like vegetables, they\u2019re probably not getting a lot of the vitamins and minerals they need.
If they\u2019re sick often, or are just feeling really tired at the end of the day, there\u2019s a chance they\u2019re vitamin deficient. If you don\u2019t do something about it, it could lead to bigger problems down the road.
If you\u2019re having trouble getting your kid to eat vegetables, don\u2019t forget dessert.
Dark chocolate has lots of antioxidants and will help boost your child\u2019s immune system if you add it to their daily diet.
Blueberries are another great choice. They\u2019re packed with vitamins and are a delicious dessert that\u2019s easy to sneak into just about anything.`),mdx("h2",null,"Try New Foods Together"),mdx("p",null,`If you\u2019re trying to get your kids to eat more veggies, you need to try new things.
It\u2019s easy to fall into a rut with dinner and keep eating the same things over and over again. If you do that with veggies, your child is going to get bored and stop eating them. If you want them to keep eating their greens, you need to try a few new things.
Start with something simple and move up from there.
If your child has never eaten a pumpkin before, you don\u2019t want to try baking a pie, but you can make a simple pumpkin soup or stew. They\u2019ll get used to the taste and feel adventurous at the same time.`),mdx("h2",null,"Take A Break"),mdx("p",null,`Kids can be fickle, and they often go through phases where they just don\u2019t want to eat.
If your child just isn\u2019t interested in eating vegetables, there\u2019s no point in forcing them.
If you force them, they\u2019ll just push them away and resent you for it.
Instead, take a break and try again later.
Sometimes kids just need to take a break from eating vegetables until they\u2019re ready to come back to them again.
If you keep trying to get your kid to eat veggies, it\u2019ll only push them away until they\u2019re completely done with eating anything that isn\u2019t pizza.
Give them time and you might find that they\u2019re ready to try vegetables again.`),mdx("h2",null,"Summing Up"),mdx("p",null,`Kids are fickle and they don\u2019t always want to eat what\u2019s good for them. If you want them to start getting more vegetables in their diet, though, you need to start working on it early and be patient.
If you\u2019re patient, your child will learn to love vegetables and will be grateful for you later on. If they don\u2019t start eating more vegetables when they\u2019re little, though, they might end up having some health issues later on in life.
If your child isn\u2019t eating vegetables, don\u2019t worry. You can help them start eating more vegetables in no time by trying different things. Just be patient and keep trying and your child will be eating their greens in no time.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Make Healthy Eating Easier with Batch Cooking
How to Stay Healthy during Cold and Flu Season

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Getting the flu or a cold is inevitable. In fact, you could get sick around this time every year without fail. The only thing you can do is take precautions and try to avoid catching a bug in the first place. However, even with good intentions and best efforts, the odds are stacked against you. These viruses are so common that virtually everyone has been exposed to them at some point in their lives, generally during childhood.
Thankfully there are ways to reduce your risk of contracting these viruses and being able to recover quickly if they manage to sneak through your defenses. Cold and flu season brings with it stressors like school, work, family obligations and end-of-year deadlines\u2014not exactly ideal conditions for keeping your immune system strong!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 10 Ways to Make Your Commute Less Stressful

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`When you think about your daily commute, it probably doesn\u2019t strike you as being particularly stressful. In fact, many people see their daily drive to work or school as a time for peace and quiet. After all, what could possibly be stressful about getting from point A to point B?
It\u2019s true that your commute isn\u2019t inherently stressful. In theory, it\u2019s just a short period of time each day when you go from home to work (or vise versa). But even the most seemingly insignificant details can make a big difference. Read on to learn more about how you can reduce stress during your commute and get to work happier every day!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Stick to Your Healthy Eating Goals

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`The New Year brings new resolutions and the challenge to stick to them. But how can you make sure you succeed this time? Planning and preparation are key to any endeavor, including sticking to your healthy eating goals in the New Year. Thinking ahead and making a plan will help you avoid pitfalls and stay on track. After all, it\u2019s not about failing once but rather keeping failure at bay so it doesn\u2019t creep up again next year.
Many people struggle with their eating habits because they lack structure or fail to plan ahead. That\u2019s why creating a strategy is essential if you want to maintain this commitment for good. Whether it\u2019s going on a diet, cutting out certain foods or reducing your intake of fats, proteins or carbs \u2013 there are different ways how you can achieve your goals. Here are some helpful tips:`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Get in Shape for Summer - Tips for Every Fitness Level

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:t,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:t,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`When summer rolls around, everyone seems to want to look their best. After all, it\u2019s the season of tank tops, swimsuits, and short shorts. The problem is that not everyone hits the gym year-round or has access to a gym that fits their needs. If you tend to slack on your fitness game once the snow begins falling and leaves start falling from the trees again, now is the time to start making changes so that you\u2019re ready for summer.
Whether you\u2019re looking for ways to get back in shape after a long winter hibernation or just hoping to avoid ending up in an unflattering bathing suit this summer, hitting the gym as often as possible is essential. But what if you don\u2019t have a gym membership? Or what if you can only commit to working out at home? Luckily we have some great tips for how you can get in shape for summer no matter where you are.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Get Moving When You Don't Have Time for the Gym

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`New Year, same old resolutions. If you\u2019re anything like the majority of people, chances are that you have made the same resolution to get fitter, healthier and happier this year as you did last year. But with a packed work schedule, social calendar and everything else going on in your life it can be difficult to find time to hit the gym or take up that new Zumba class you signed up for last October but never went to again.
And yet so many of us do manage to get moving. Yes, it might involve setting your alarm an hour earlier than usual, waking up on Saturday morning instead of Friday night and putting in some serious dedication \u2014 but it is possible. So if you\u2019re struggling to find time for the gym here are some creative ways how you can get moving when you don\u2019t have time for the gym:`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 8 Ways to Make Healthy Eating More Exciting

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:t,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:t,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`In today\u2019s world, it\u2019s not easy to stick to healthy eating habits. Everywhere you look there are temptations that make it difficult to eat the right things. However, with the right approach and mindset, healthy eating doesn\u2019t have to be boring or restrictive. You just need a bit of inspiration and ideas on how to make healthy eating exciting again. Eating well doesn\u2019t need to be dull or uninteresting \u2013 in fact, it can be quite the opposite if you bring your A-game to the table.
If you\u2019re struggling with making healthy eating more exciting, here are some ways that can help get you back on track so you can enjoy great food while still feeling good about what you\u2019re putting in your body.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Benefits of Regular Exercise - And How to Get Started

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"Getting into a regular workout routine is something that\u2019s a lot easier said than done for most people. While some of us have it easier than others when it comes to fitting fitness into our busy lives, we all struggle with different things at one point or another. It\u2019s easy to let other responsibilities fall by the wayside and not get moving, so you need to be strategic about how and when you work out. While there are many different benefits to exercise, the biggest thing that it has to offer is stress reduction. If you\u2019re looking for ways to reduce your stress in your everyday life, adding exercise to your routine is a great place to start. Here are some reasons why getting your sweat on regularly could be exactly what you need right now:"))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Get Started with a Plant-Based Diet

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`If you\u2019ve been reading the news or browsing Instagram recently, you may have noticed a growing trend of plant-based diets. Famous celebrities, athletes and even foodies are swearing off meat and animal products to lead a more plant-based life.
This practice is also known as \u201Cveganism\u201D or an \u201Cethical vegan\u201D diet. In addition to eating plants for most of your calories, a plant-based diet eliminates or reduces your consumption of animal products like meat, eggs, dairy and honey.
The reasons for going plant-based are as varied as the people who do it. Some people feel that this diet is the best way to reduce their carbon footprint and live in harmony with nature. Others see it as a healthier alternative to the Standard American Diet (SAD).
Many simply like the taste of plants more than meat. Whatever your reason for trying a plant- A great first step is learning how to start with these tips!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`When you\u2019re anxious, you feel your heart pounding, and your palms get sweaty. We\u2019ve all experienced some level of anxiety from time to time \u2014 it can be perfectly normal. However, for some people, anxiety can become debilitating and start to have a negative impact on their everyday life. If you experience social anxiety or general anxiety more often than not, read on to discover how to deal with it effectively.
If you struggle with anxiety frequently and strongly, you are certainly not alone. In fact, almost 20% of adults in the United States experience some form of anxiety or another on a regular basis. Although there is no magical cure for dealing with anxiety permanently, there are many things that you can do to manage your symptoms better and live a happier life as a result.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
